decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing cycling creatures like Street Wraith and Architects of Will, as well as cascade spells like Shardless Agent and Ardent Plea, to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures. Once enough creatures are in the graveyard, the deck casts Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence and win the game in a single turn. Force of Negation and other disruptive spells help protect the combo and ensure its success.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while applying constant pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also includes removal options like Fatal Push and Unholy Heat to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring allows for additional mana ramp and flexibility in deck construction. The deck aims to control the board and apply quick, consistent damage to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on efficiently controlling the board while dealing quick damage to the opponent using a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional mana fixing and a potential late-game threat. Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional reach and removal options. Ragavan and Territorial Kavu offer early pressure, while Scion of Draco can quickly close out the game. The deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to create a fast-paced, aggressive strategy using cards that have synergies with each other. By combining creatures like Nishoba Brawler, Scion of Draco, Wild Nacatl, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact, Stubborn Denial, and Leyline Binding helps to control the board and protect your aggressive creatures. By playing a mix of lands that support all the colors needed, the deck can consistently execute its game plan.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays using cheap, efficient spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent quickly. The deck relies on cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage and Dragon's Rage Channeler for card selection. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra source of mana. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of burn spells and creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while maintaining pressure with cards like Lava Dart and Slickshot Show-Off. Land base prioritizes fetch lands for consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Hardened Scales card to maximize the value of +1/+1 counters on creatures and artifacts. It includes cards like Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker to benefit from the increased counters, as well as Inkmoth Nexus for additional infect damage potential. The deck also includes support cards like Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and Welding Jar to protect key pieces and ensure a strong board presence. The strategy revolves around quickly building up a threatening board state and overwhelming the opponent with powerful, synergistic plays.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive strategies to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It includes low-cost spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Skewer the Critics, as well as efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The aim is to consistently apply pressure, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm to control the board and finish off the opponent. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency in casting spells and maximizing damage output.

This red aggro deck relies heavily on quick and efficient burn spells combined with aggressive creatures to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. Featuring cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero while also utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Dragon's Rage Channeler for card advantage and selection. By overwhelming the opponent with a mix of burn spells and creatures, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

This deck focuses on dealing quick and efficient damage to the opponent through a combination of low-cost spells and creatures. The key strategy is to establish board presence early with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the opponent's board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and resources. By maintaining a fast pace and applying constant pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create a powerful synergy that can overwhelm opponents. By using creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide, Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons, and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can generate value through sacrificing creatures and manipulating +1/+1 counters. The toolbox aspect allows for flexibility in finding the right creature for any situation, while the combo potential provides opportunities for explosive plays. The deck thrives on resource management and careful planning to execute its game plan efficiently and effectively.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through artifact manipulation and counterspells, while generating value through a combination of Urza, Lord High Artificer, Thopter Foundry, and Sword of the Meek. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for additional utility with equipment like Shadowspear and Kaldra Compleat. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence with Urza's Saga and protect its key pieces with cards like Metallic Rebuke and Pithing Needle. The deck also includes some land and mana ramp options to ensure consistency and flexibility in its gameplay.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption, utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dauthi Voidwalker to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes powerful disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Grief and Not Dead After All provide additional disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with its aggressive creatures and disruption spells, while also having some late-game power with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger.
